label: FGPB-101
description: A real push button (switch) available in several colors.

1.label: Lifeline
1.description: reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default)

2.label: On/Off
2.description: assigned to clicking the button and is used to turn on/off associated devices

3.label: Dimmer
3.description: is assigned to holding the button and is used to change level of associated devices

4.label: Alarm
4.description: assigned to clicking and/or holding the button (triggers are defined in parameter 30) and is used to send alarm frames to associated devices

10.label: Key Pressed 1 time – command sent to 2nd association group
10.description: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a single click.

11.label: Key Pressed 1 time – value of SWITCH ON command sent to 2nd association group

12.label: Key Pressed 2 times – command sent to 2nd association group
12.description: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a double click.

13.label: Key Pressed 2 times – value of SWITCH ON command sent to 2nd association group

14.label: Key Pressed 3 times – command sent to 2nd association group
14.description: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a triple click.

15.label: Key Pressed 3 times – value of SWITCH ON command sent to 2nd association group

20.label: Key Pressed 1 time – command sent to 3rd association group
20.description: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a single click.

21.label: Key Pressed 1 time – value of SWITCH ON command sent to 3rd association group

22.label: Key Pressed 2 times – command sent to 3rd association group
22.description: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a double click.

23.label: Key Pressed 2 times – value of SWITCH ON command sent to 3rd association group

24.label: Key Pressed 3 times – command sent to 3rd association group
24.description: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a triple click.

25.label: Key Pressed 3 times – value of SWITCH ON command sent to 3rd association group

29.label: Key Held Down – command sent to 3rd association group
29.description: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after holding the button down.

1[0x01].label: Scenes sent to the controller: Key Pressed 1 time

1[0x02].label: Scenes sent to the controller: Key Pressed 2 times

1[0x04].label: Scenes sent to the controller: Key Pressed 3 times

1[0x08].label: Scenes sent to the controller: Key Pressed 4 times

1[0x10].label: Scenes sent to the controller: Key Pressed 5 times

1[0x20].label: Scenes sent to the controller: Key Held Down

1[0x40].label: Scenes sent to the controller: Key Released

3[0x01].label: Associations: Send secure commands to 2nd group
3[0x01].description: This is only active when the node is included securely

3[0x02].label: Associations: Send secure commands to 3rd group
3[0x02].description: This is only active when the node is included securely

3[0x04].label: Associations: Send secure commands to 4th group
3[0x04].description: This is only active when the node is included securely

30[0x01].label: Send Alarm Frame to 4th Association Group: Key Pressed 1 time

30[0x02].label: Send Alarm Frame to 4th Association Group: Key Pressed 2 times

30[0x04].label: Send Alarm Frame to 4th Association Group: Key Pressed 3 times

30[0x08].label: Send Alarm Frame to 4th Association Group: Key Pressed 4 times

30[0x10].label: Send Alarm Frame to 4th Association Group: Key Pressed 5 times

30[0x20].label: Send Alarm Frame to 4th Association Group: Key Held Down

30[0x40].label: Send Alarm Frame to 4th Association Group: Key Released

metadata.inclusion:
1) Place the Button within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.
2) Set the main controller in (security/non-security) add mode (see the controller’s manual).
3) Click the Button at least six times.
4) Wait for the adding process to end.
5) Successful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.
metadata.exclusion:
1) Place the Button within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.
2) Set the main controller in remove mode (see the controller’s manual).
3) Click the Button at least six times.
4) Wait for the removing process to end.
5) Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.
metadata.reset:
Reset procedure allows to restore the device back to its factory settings, which means all information about the Z-Wave controller and user configuration will be deleted. In order to reset the device:
1) Click the Button exactly five times.
2) Press and hold the Button for at least 5 seconds.
Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable
